page.title: 05Entertainment in Eastchurch
page.content: The{entertainment}in Eastchurch is centred around the Village{Hall,} Working Men's Club and the Pubs. The village hall was built after World War 2 with money raised by the villagers. The committee which runs the hall organise weekly whist drives, bingo and a social{club}for the disabled. The hall is also used for private functions. All the activities are well supported by the local community. The working men's club offers snooker, billiards, a bar and a weekly disco. At Christmas a children's party is organised. The local{pubs}provide another form of entertainment. They are used by the local people and by the influx of holidaymakers during the summer. The village holds a popular, annual carnival.
